subject: Re: Article That Should Help Testing: "Five Habits of Highly
msgSnippet: ... Or in a Command object: interface Command { public void execute();} public class FileProcessor { public static void process(File f, Command c) { f.open();
messageBody:
> > Yes. Operations that need to be mirrored (opening/closing)
> probably don't
> > belong in the constructor since Java doesn't give us an obvious
> > counterpart.
>
> I think they belong in a template method, myself.

Or in a Command object:

interface Command { public void execute();}

public class FileProcessor {
public static void process(File f, Command c) {
f.open();
c.execute();
f.close();
}
}

This is roughly equivalent to the Ruby idiom of using blocks:

def processfile(f, &proc)
f.open
proc.call(f)
f.close
end

Which lets you do:
processFile(myFile) {|theFile| ...}
